item.description:
LIVE COMEDY at
The Governor's Inn !!!
Fri, Nov. 4

The Best in Boston Club Comedy!
  Hi Trailblazers, this is a late notice, but come out for a fun night of
Comedy  at the Governors Inn. Look for me there! Tkts $10 in advance (call 332-0107)
$15 at the door or after 5pm day of show  Doors open at 6:30pm ... start your evening with the fun menu from
Spaulding Steak & Ale restaurant.
20% menu discount for
seating in the Comedy Ballroom!

 Fri, Nov. 4 with
Kelly Macfarland
and Jay Grove!  (see story below)

An animated, clever, and sassy professional with an alluring smile and intense energy, Macfarland  shares her life experiences in a unique way, telling it 'like it is' and leaving audiences pleasantly surprised by her candor.  She captivates the crowd with her charm, and her refreshing positive attitude makes her irresistible.  Recently Macfarland has been the opening act for Melissa Etheridge concerts and was featured in Boston Magazine's 'Best of Boston' issue.   Kelly has also appeared in the Boston Comedy Festival and was first runner up in the Comedy Central Laugh Riots Semi-Final Competition in Boston.

Article in Fosters:

ROCHESTER — Headline comedy returns to the Lilac City on Friday, Nov. 4 when the Governor's Inn brings top shelf Boston area comedians to its ballroom stage.

Comedian Kelly MacFarland headlines the show. An animated, clever, and sassy professional with an alluring smile and intense energy, McFarland shares her life experiences in a unique way, telling it "like it is" and leaving audiences pleasantly surprised by her candor. She captivates the crowd with her charm, and her refreshing positive attitude makes her irresistible.

Having just returned from entertaining our US troops overseas, MacFarland has appeared several times on Comedy Central and has also been the opening act for Melissa Etheridge and LeAnn Rimes concerts. She was featured in “Boston Magazine's” "Best of Boston" issue and has appeared in the Boston Comedy Festival and also was first runner up in the Comedy Central Laugh Riots Semi-Final Competition in Boston.

MacFarland will be joined by comic Jay Grove — finalist in the Boston Comedy Festival — who will "warm" up MacFarland. Grove's fast-paced and punched-up tales of small town upbringing, coupled with his rapport with crowds and love of having a good time, have made him a crowd favorite from coast to coast. His material is known for giving comedy fans the feeling that they're joking around with an old friend instead of sitting through an "act."

Tickets to the show are $10 in advance, and $15 at the door, which opens at 6:30 p.m. Guests who order from the Spaulding Steak and Ale menu in the ballroom receive a 20 percent discount for attending the show. For more information and a menu, visit www.governorsinn.com or call (603) 332-0107.
